output.conclusion: This course provides a foundational understanding of physiotherapy principles and practices. By completing this course, you should have a strong grasp of the core concepts and be prepared for more advanced studies in physiotherapy.
output.introduction: Welcome to Physiotherapy Fundamentals! This course is designed for beginners and will introduce you to the core principles, concepts, and practices of physiotherapy. We will cover basic anatomy, biomechanics, and common therapeutic techniques.

chapters.description: What is physiotherapy? History and evolution of physiotherapy. Scope of practice and professional roles. Ethical considerations in physiotherapy.
Introduction to anatomical planes and movements. Key anatomical structures relevant to physiotherapy (bones, muscles, joints). Common anatomical terminology.
Detailed review of the skeletal system. Focus on major bones and joints. Common musculoskeletal injuries and conditions.

modules.moduleTitle: Introduction to Physiotherapy and Basic Anatomy

chapters.description: Introduction to biomechanics and its relevance to physiotherapy. Levers, forces, and motion. Application of biomechanical principles to human movement.
Understanding normal posture and balance. Common postural deviations. Assessment and correction of postural imbalances.
Phases of gait cycle. Normal gait patterns. Common gait deviations and their causes.
Principles of therapeutic exercise. Types of therapeutic exercises (ROM, strengthening, stretching). Indications and contraindications for therapeutic exercise.
Introduction to manual therapy. Palpation skills. Basic massage techniques (effleurage, petrissage). Joint mobilization principles.
Overview of electrotherapy modalities (TENS, ultrasound). Cryotherapy and thermotherapy. Indications and contraindications for common modalities.
